page.title: 10Horningsham Luncheon Club
page.content: The Luncheon Club meets in the Village Hall every Thursday. Most of the members are either old age pensioners or disabled. Some people are unable to get to the hall and their meals are taken to them. Some of the members are brought in by cars from as far away as Warminster and Maiden Bradley. Altogether there are twenty-four voluntary helpers although usually only twelve help at any one time. The charge for a meal is 65p The Club also holds a Christmas party when sherry is served in addition to the traditional roast turkey. In addition to the money paid by members for their meal, a large grant comes from the Wiltshire County Council.
